pros: Lovely staff, very helpful, great atmosphere, good resources
cons: Miss information on the students. Students left without lecturer for 3 months

review_title: I would rather be unemployed than work here again
pros: The only good side was staff members, mostly lecturers, being supportive and friendly
cons: Bullying management. Very low pay compared with other local colleges. Extreme workload for part time. Unpaid hours for parents evenings and open days. Completely unsupportive and unprofessional management. Lecturers expected to be submissive at all times. Unsubstantiated students complaints held as truth and used to further put down lecturers.

review_title: Purposeful work, but a disjointed organisation with poor management and uncompetitive pay.
pros:
- Nice colleagues with lots of experience and life insight.
- Nice campus at Chichester.
- Purposeful work, at times.
- IT department updating the systems, finally moving to a more digital approach.
- Staff awards provide for recognition. 
- Reception teams are reliable, friendly and helpful.
cons:
- Communication from department managers (DHoLs, HOL, VP) is sub-standard. Constant sense of not knowing. This wouldn't be tolerated in other sectors (e.g. tech, retail, finance, banking). 

- Managers can be 'one-man-bands' and lack leadership, team-work and facilitative skills. Some managers are Teflon-like; you don't get an answer to questions or concerns raised. 

- DHoLs and HOL's don't value administrative staff enough. It's now two weeks into the new academic year and members of the department management team haven't discussed priorities in a 1-1 / stand-up. It's poor, disrespectful and highlights weak team leadership. 

- Pay is uncompetitive. 

- People are in job roles that have not been been evaluated for years; they are paid more for less responsibility and a lower personal specification than people in newer roles. It's completely unacceptable. HR and department budget holder offered nothing when pointing this out to them.

- No career progression for administrative staff.

- Changes to the campus are made within staff consultation, therefore cannot be changed post-facto.

pros:
Longstanding leadership structure
Professional and organised
Creative and Fun
cons:
Long hours
Old buildings 
Slow and complex technology infrastructure

job_title: Lecturer of English in Chichester, England
pros: Great team to work with, good classrooms and equipment, some great students who have failed in the school system and need their English GCSE to progress in their chosen vocation.
cons: Some challenging students, culture of nepotism especially in management, too much focus on the profit and not the student experience

pros: Lovely people to work with
cons: Not family friendly working patterns

pros: Caring, dedicated staff who deliver over and above
cons: Lack of funding means salaries low

job_title: International Business Development Officer in Chichester, England
pros: Lovely team, everyone was hard working, and supported each other.
cons: Complete change of management due to redundancies so can't comment on current or new working styles.

job_title: Lecturer In Painting and Decorating With Effects in Chichester, England
pros: Great staff, very supportive, left to get on and use your own initiative
cons: Big IT structure, lots if online training

pros: Good team to work with
cons: Poor management and nepotism in the college

pros: i liked the people who worked there
cons: i wasn't very well supported

review_title: Excellent teaching and business support staff, let down by poor management and organisation
pros:
As with most teaching jobs, excellent holiday entitlement.
Good pay compared to other colleges.
Many wonderful colleagues that are willing to go far beyond their job descriptions to help.
cons:
Poor leadership and decision making by managers leaving teaching staff overwhelmed and unsupported.
Being 'inclusive', meaning that everyone is accepted on courses, even if they are completely unsuitable.
The ever increasing workload without the promised remission. 
Pressure to pass students that are not capable just to improve achievement/success rates.

pros: Fantastic, warm and friendly people to work  with. Chichester college has received outstanding as a college and this was achieved because of the dedication of the staff. Facilities at the college are good for staff, it's almost like a small village in itself.
cons: As with all large organisations communication could be improved across different departments. Working in chichester is also difficult because of the traffic on the a27 and when everyone leaves at the same time on a Friday!

job_title: Business Lecturer in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Opportunity to teach and train on a variety of courses. This provides experience to become an outstanding lecturer. Strategically led to achieve Ofsted outstanding grade.
cons: Lack of progression available due to budget restrictions & internal politics. Too much micro management & support for new staff with teaching. Duplication of resources.

pros: I work with an amazing staff team who are not only inspirational colleagues but good friends.  I get to teach a variety of students who challenge me, inspire me and keep me young - I love watching them grow.
cons:
I work more hours than I should!
Paperwork and "red tape systems" are a curse.
The facilities in my area are seriously outdated

job_title: Halls of Residence Supervisor in Chichester, England
pros:
The level of care for the students is very high
The surroundings are lovely
cons:
There is a problem with staff morale at the moment
More emphasis needs to be placed on drawing staff together

job_title: Curriculum Administration Assistant in Chichester, England
pros: Regular salary increments, Good people in the teams.
cons: No perks, have to pay for parking, takes ages to employ replacements. Big bonuses only go to SMT. Staff training days centred around employees completing courses to get the college government funding... which have no relevance to your job!!

pros: Management very friendly and approachable, days between Christmas and new year off in addition to annual leave entitlement.
cons: Salaries for non teaching staff is low, as usual in public sector.

pros: Great college . Great leadership. Negotiate your salary before accepting a position
cons: Take your own lunch as limited healthy food
